title: Kravitz lookalike??
content:
Hey guys an gals,

Just a quick question to ask if anyone knows of a good licence font that is similar to Kravitz by Ben Balvanz. I like the look of the new Aspirin Advance font from T26 or Byrant from Process :)

I’ve tried every way I can to get in contact with Ben to licence Kravitz, but to no avail.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Aaron.

author: aeron

comments.content:
_You could create your very own, slightly modified, unicase version of ‘ [Century Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528001123/http:/www.identifont.com/show?1N2)’, maybe.? :)_

But, ‘ [UniF](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528001123/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/unif.asp)’, by [Nina David](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528001123/http:/www.font-o-rama.com/), may be a classy, contemporary alternate..

_( Two more, rather famous, unicase typefaces.: ‘ [Cholla](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528001123/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=E.113861.0.27)’ ( Unicase ), by Sibylle Hagmann, and, ‘ [Panoptica Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528001123/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=NS.116943.0.6)’, by [Nick Shinn](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528001123/http:/www.shinntype.com/).. )_

Thanks so much for your detailed response :-)

Some excellent suggestions there, and if I’d caught this not 30 minutes ago I probably would have went with either Century Gothic or UniF, but I ended up going with Byrant, which I’m happy with, the only thing I failed to notice was that it wasn’t unicase [I’m going to assume Unicase is where fonts mix up upper and lower case in one case, ala Kravitz].  
I thought I would be able to sucessfully modify the lettering in Photoshop to get the mix of cases I wanted.. I think I will have to fiddle alittle more :)

Thanks again for your help, very much appreciated!

Regards, Aaron.
